dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An operator is asleep, in front of all his screens that g black one after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOOR SUPERVISOR is lying in a corner, unconscious. A voice yells through the radio at his belt.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Security, we have a break-in, get to Section... The communication is cut off. The DOOR SUPERVISOR slowly comes back to life. He stands up, holding his head. He takes his radio out.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Jay? Jay...? Did you see it on your screens? Y Y y No response. DOOR SUPERVISOR (cont'd) Jay? No response. DOOR SUPERVISOR (cont'd) (louder)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Still no response, he gives up and walks. Soon he hears s noise, that gets louder and louder. DOOR SUPERVISOR (cont'd) What...? He reaches a larger corridor, with many doors on both wal The loud voices sound to come from one of the rooms in th back. A small group of people - three men, one of them in a whi overall, and one woman -, rushes out of one of those roo a distance. They look enraged, snarling, drooling blood. eyes are blood red. They turn their heads almost at the s time and see him, and they violently freeze, looking dagg at him; then they run straight to him, faster and faster, snarling ferociously. The heavy pain stops him from quickly realizing what's happening. When he finally does, it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big white truck is parked just outside, facing the lab entrance door. Two men, two ACTIVISTS, seated on the fron seats, are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one on the passenger's seat keeps his eyes on his out mirror. He moves as he sees his teammates rushing out.

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVIST
dialogues.text: Here they are!

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVIST
dialogues.text: About time.

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVIST
dialogues.text: (frowning) They're not carrying anything.

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVIST
dialogues.text: Open the back doors. ACTIVIST #1 is uncertain as he still leaves his seat, on way to open the back doors. He does it and the first and thing he sees is his female teammate, MIKA, standing righ front of him, looking straight at him. Her eyes are blood her face, expressionless. The only thing she carries is one single monkey. Dead, co with blood.

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVIST
dialogues.text: (interrogative) Mika... She suddenly snarls and throws herself towards him, maki both fall inside the truck. She bites him ferociously in throat, he yells with heavy pain. DAVID (Activist #2) turns and sees this, frozen. He stand staying close to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mika! MIKA! What the hell are you doing? What is this? MIKA stops the biting and looks up at DAVID, who discover evil version of the woman he knows. Her eyes are red dagg pointed straight at him, ready to be thrown. Almost supernaturally, she stands up, about to attack him as she does, DAVID sits back down and puts his foot down. MIKA is thrown backwards, out of the truck. DAVID can see ending up on the pavement, through his rear-view mirror. keeps driving away. ACTIVIST #1 is still inside the truck. Kind of convulsing the floor. DAVID sees this too, in his mirror. He stops t truck, and turns to his mate.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Bruce...? He sees BRUCE (Activist #1) standing up in his turn. Then BRUCE turns, abruptly, showing DAVID a horrible face, tot twisted. Before giving him the time to rush him, DAVID op his door and gets out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Slamming the door behind him. He runs away, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What used to be BRUCE keeps snarling in the truck as he watches DAVID running away. Its rabid condition makes it unable to think good enough to open the doors normally. I runs out through the back - and 'joins' its infected 'teammates' as they attack anybody else in sight. DAVID keeps running until he reaches a phone box. He gets inside.  INT. PHONE BOX — DAY He picks up the phone and dials the police number and spe as the fury starts to spread outside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: this is an emergency. Yes! Hurry. I have to go now. You don't believe me, then believe CCTV! He hangs up and stays there, waiting. Then he walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts running back to the truck as fury and panic gai ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets back into the truck through the driver's door and locks it, as he starts the engine again an infected shows banging the window. DAVID drives away, quickly. He turns and through the back doors that are still open, sees that he's chased by at least two infected ones, runn very fast. As one of them is about to board the vehicle h drives faster, losing the thing that falls down on the pavement. EXT. STREETS — DAY He has to jump a light that just went red, and the infect give up on him, rushing other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out his own cell phone, dials a longer number.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Honey... it's me, David. Everything's all right? Okay look... you have to quit your job right now. Don't ask me why, just do it. Go to school and pick up the kids at the exit. I'm on my way there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WANDA is a beautiful brunette veterinarian, in a white overall. She's working on a sick pet.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? DAVID (v.o.) Just do as I say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID (cont'd) Something terrible is gonna happen, it's actually happening right now and it's gonna hit the news in any minute. You need to act before it hits the news. You got that? You go now. WOMAN (v.o.) David, what's the problem? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No time to explain! Just trust me and do as I say. Go to school. I won't make you promise because we don't have time. Just do it. Okay? Do it NOW. He cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WANDA's teammate PENNY is in the same room.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (after a break) Give me the remote. PENNY picks it up and throws it to her, she puts up the v on a TV set. Then she keeps changing channels, until she on BBC News. She doesn't see anything so special right away, so she p her phone down and keeps working on her pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHARINE HARRIS, a police detective, is inside her own office, on the phone behind her desk, receiving an emerge call, taking notes with a pen.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Thank you. She stands up, a piece of paper in her hand. She looks da She leaves her office and walks through the station, stra empty. Almost everybody has converged towards another off A private office. They are all gathered at the door, and pretty agitated, all talking together at the same time. She manages to find her way through the pack and sees the LIEUTENANT in his office, seated behind his desk. There i pile of reports on the table. He's busy reading one of th then he gets rid of it and takes another on the pile. After a very short moment he gets rid of it as well and g another he gets rid of quickly, then he looks up at the p packed at his door.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? (as he stands up) God knows if I have worked plenty of cases at the same time in my career, but this... (he shakes his head) ...this is nuts. He leaves his office through the human pack. Nobody says thing to him, except... ...KATHARINE, who hands him the report she has.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, we just received some more calls, we also have some footage now, coming from CCTV operators, may I suggest you have a look? The LIEUTENANT stops and looks at her, stunned. He sees report. KATHARINE (cont'd) I got all of it on my computer.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: You're not the only one. It's already everywhere. He passes her, not taking the report. He looks highly surprised about how quickly all this is g The reports had come in within less than fifteen minutes, all of them were about the same thing. LIEUTENANT (cont'd) Let's have that look. I hope it's not some stupid kid joke. He goes to a corner of the station where a big screen is high up on a wall. It's divided into 16 square screens. The LIEUTENANT enters the place, almost all his squad fol The footage is played as soon as he looks up. What they see defies our imagination. It is like a riot, with something else. The police or army is not involved. civilian people attacking other civilian people, and doin with extreme violence... and for absolutely no reason. Everybody is watching, like hypnotized, unable to move an anything. It lasts a moment until the LIEUTENANT turns.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing? Wake up! They all do as he speaks. LIEUTENANT (cont'd) What? Am I dumb, or am I supposed to go out there by myself and play Rambo on these guys? Just move and send all units there! Everything you have! And I want the whole area sealed off within a 30-mile radius! 30 miles, you hear me? The ones concerned disperse at once. Some others stay cl him. KATHARINE included. As he watches again:

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Sir, there's something I need to show you. It's very important.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: What? We are watching it right now.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: That report is about something on the footage. About what could have started this. It's there but I suggest we have a look.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: We have footage about this?

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Apparently yes.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Let's see it. They go to a desk and a computer on it, controlling the b screen, and both have a seat in front.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: One CCTV operator found it and wrote that report he followed to us as quickly as he could. She starts working on the computer and soon, the big scre shows one image instead of sixteen. She rewinds the image KATHARINE (cont'd) Okay... apparently it all started from that spot. The image shows a big white truck, with no outside mark o brand, parking. Then... three black shapes coming off the back, entering a building.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: What is this? Some robbery?

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: It may be what happened before this (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 KATHARINE (cont'd) whole thing started, sir. Those three guys are hooded, but they have no guns.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: They have no guns? What's making you so sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: I'm not, sir. The operator is. You should be as well when you see what happens next. Now the place they just got in, it's not a bank or anything else financial. It's something else.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: It can be anything. Like some flat.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Not on this. I don't think any robber would break in any flat in downtown London during daytime.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Don't be too sure about that either. She fast-forwards the tape.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: From the report, they came out six minutes later. She keeps fast-forwarding, until... the footage shows the coming out. Five people instead of three. All acting mad. And attacki people at once.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (astonished) My God...

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Notice anything?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Yes, that's the starting point all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 And the three guys, sir, the three guys.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: They brought out some friends.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: With their hoods off. They don't wear them any more.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: That's right. This means we'll be able to identify them. This is very good.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Sir, you won't be able to even go for them. They've gone mad. They're finished.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Of course. She freezes the image.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Yes, the guy in white...

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Must be some scientist. Doctor, researcher.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: It means that the guys broke in medical or research place. Like clinic, or a lab. And that they unleashed something that should stayed locked.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Yes... holy shit. She plays the footage again. or have  12

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: Look at this. The footage shows the truck abruptly starting, then stopp about fifty yards ahead. Then the driver gets out of the truck and runs away, frantically, like he's chased by the Devil Himself. Until enters a phone box. The guy is all dressed in black, like those who entered t mysterious place. He's not hooded.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: He escaped from his own friends.

dialogues.speaker: KATHARINE
dialogues.text: It's possible to identify this guy.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (showing no joy) Good, you do that. Very good job. (he stands up) You do that while I alert all the medias, right away. She nods, he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is still heading to the school. His radio is on. As approaches the school, he begins to hear about the myster wave of fury.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: we have to interrupt our programs to report you of something totally unusual currently happening on the streets of London... several assaults, still unexplained, have occurred and apparently haven't stopped yet... we are waiting for more details from the police but the motives of these aggressions are still to be... DAVID manages to park the truck, he has to turn off the r as he gets out. He runs to the school entrance.  13 INT. VETERINARIAN SHOP — DAY WANDA looks stunned as she watches the first TV developme Her eyes and mouth widen. The news is hosted by one single man, revealing the break info: WAVE OF FURY BREAKING OUT IN LONDON

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST
dialogues.text: It has started for about twenty minutes and doesn't seem to have stopped, since reports from calling witnesses are still coming in... again, a mysterious wave of assault is currently occurring in London, many people have been attacked, for no apparent reason, and the number is still growing. We still have no precisions about what is still causing these assaults but as it develops we'll keep you informed... WANDA suddenly drops her tools and turns, runs to her coa handbag and rushes out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: PENNY
dialogues.text: The door slams, the pet moans on the table. The door reopens, WANDA reappears.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Penny, close the place and go. She slams the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID walks to a big reception desk. There are two WOMEN behind, he goes to one of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Hi Mister.  14

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my kids...

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Are they all admitted here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They are. Please tell me where my eldest son Robert is.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: He's probably having his class. Can you give me a good reason why I should give you this info?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (hesitating) When is the class finishing?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (checking her watch) All the current classes finish in... seven, eight minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I need the classroom location or its number. Please.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (impatient) He's my son, I need to talk to him personally, and I need to do it now. I won't make any trouble, I won't interrupt the class, I promise. Just give me the room location or its number, I'll go and wait at the door until the bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (sighing) Give me your name. And your son's. She finally gives him the info, a bit reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.  15 He leaves quickly. The RECEPTIONIST notices. As DAVID climbs some stairs the two women at the receptio desk hear from a small TV set about what's happening. The sound is low but they can hear. They focus on the screen, suddenly highly worried. Soon some portraits of suspects come up. The RECEPTIONIST talked with David recognizes him quickly from one of them She picks up the phone, dials 999.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID walks through an empty corridor, watching the walls looking for a door with the correct number. He finally fi it. He looks inside the classroom through a rather small squa glass window, trying to spot Robert, his eldest son, amon the pupils. Some of the kids turn their heads to him. None of them is Robert's but DAVID manages to locate him. He fights the urge to get into the room and drag his son deciding to wait for the class to finish. His teeth clinc he looks at his watch. Four minutes before the bell ring. He stays put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE OFFICERS in uniforms, walk in, both RECEPTIONI wave to them and they go to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ladies...

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (the one who talked with David, sounding concerned) Officer, what is this on television?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Don't you worry. We'll get this under control. Are you the ones who called us?  16

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Yes. The man you're looking for about this, is here. And...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) He's here?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: That's what I said on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Good. Which way?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Sir, before I answer that question, there's something I have to tell you about... something I DIDN'T mention on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: The guy is looking for his kids here. He was looking very concerned. He was sounding almost panicked. He was LOOKING in panic. And he left running.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: So I believe he knows much more about what's going on than you guys do. (very seriously) Sir... what is going on? She looks at the TV screen. The two COPS and the other receptionist do the same. The have broken all over. It's everywhere. The images showed awful. RECEPTIONIST #1 (cont'd) (turning to the two cops) You said that you will get this situation under control... are you sure about that?  17

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We will. That's what we're paid for.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ain't we? Both women stare at them, saying nothing, not convinced a all. OFFICER #1 takes out an envelope, then he takes out big p from them.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Now... can you tell us which way you sent the guy? You know he's wanted.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I do. (waving her arm, showing the direction) I sent him to the second floor. She gives a door number. OFFICER #1 lays the photos on the desk. They are portrait The same ones that were showed on TV. Four men, one woman

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Which one is it? RECEPTIONIST #1 immediately points at David's photo.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Is he involved in what is happening?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: You don't need to know.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I'll take it as a yes.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Whatever.  18 As the two COPS leave with the photos, the bell rings. Lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, letting out a whole bunch of shouting kid DAVID watches carefully. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shouting louder) Rob! Almost all the kids turn to him. Only one of them calls b ROBERT, a blond-haired boy, twelve years old.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Daddy! He runs to DAVID and they hug each other. ROBERT (cont'd) Dad, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Why? I have two classes left...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's okay. You will catch up. Now I'll ask you to trust your dad. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You have your mobile?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes, I have it but dad, I have to go...  19

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're gonna call your brother and sister, and you're gonna do it now.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (surprisingly) Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you trust your dad?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes but...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Then do as I say and don't ask so many questions.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good boy. You tell them to go to the exit, and to stay there until your mother shows and picks you up.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (disconcerted, blinking, after a couple of seconds) All right.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do it now. ROBERT takes out his mobile phone, and they start walking together along the corridor that progressively goes empty if it's still packed. They turn a corner and DAVID spots two shapes in uniforms a distance. Police uniforms. DAVID (cont'd) What's happening? Do you get anything?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I'm trying to reach Emilia, there's no answer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Keep trying. Let it ring.  20 They keep walking, and DAVID notices the two cops holding something. Like an envelope. Looking down at it, then bac him, alternatively. Identification. Sooner or later they will recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey sonny...

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'll have to leave you.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (more and more disconcerted) Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do exactly as I said. You call your brother and sister and meet them at the school exit. And you stay there until your mother picks up all of you. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes dad but...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did I make myself clear?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If they ask you why, just tell them that 'Dad told you to'. Is that a deal?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yeah but... where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: One last thing to do. I'll see you at home. Sooner than expected. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Sure.  21

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Bye son. He turns and walks the other way. He walks, very normally. Among people taking different directions. He keeps walking, straight ahead, without tak the same corner. Fighting the urge to turn round. He takes the next corner and takes out his mobile phone, starts to walk faster. He dials Wanda's number. And he looks over his shoulder. He doesn't see the cops right away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Honey, where are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WANDA's car rolls fast.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'm on my way to the school, Dave! I'm coming. DAVID (v.o.) Okay, fine! Fine. ETA?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Five, I guess. DAVID (v.o.) Should be okay. Pick 'em up fast, straight-up, all right? Don't waste any time.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Dave, what is this all about?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No chat now! Just get the kids and go home!  22 He cuts, puts the mobile away and stops, turning to the c The corridor is still rather crowded as they come closer him, as he shows his back to the wall. They all stand there for a short moment. The cops are a b surprised by his attitude, not trying to run away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Please don't cuff my hands here. There are kids around.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We can wait until they're all out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Okay, we can't. But there is a procedure. Turn around, face the wall. (David turns.) Spread your legs. (David spreads his legs.) Hands behind your back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (as he puts his hands behind his back) Be discreet.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Shut up. He takes out a pair of cuffs, and ties DAVID's wrists wit them. Then they both grab him and take him away. EXT. SCHOOL —- DAY As he's taken by the two cops through the school main yar the exit... ...DAVID sees his three kids standing close to the gate. He freezes and turns away at once.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hey! What the f...?  23

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's my kids over there.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, really.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: And you don't want them to see you like this?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I thought you were a good dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Cut that shit out. And get a trash bag to cover my head. Both cops chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) The world's gone crazy.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Take it easy, we're just fucking with you. (catching a kid passing by) Hey kiddo, go get us a trash bag. A clean one, and fast. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same cops, taking a man in black, with his head cover a black trash bag, away from the school through the gate, towards a police car parked by. Among the people standing by the gate and watching, are DAVID's three kids who didn't recognize their father and the connection. The man with the trash bag over his head is pushed inside car, which rolls away ten seconds later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stay quiet in the car for some time.  24 Both police officers look relax, with the feeling of a jo well done. DAVID looks different, he keeps looking outside the car, then right then straight ahead, sometimes in the back. In directions. He doesn't look frantic. But he's like he's feeling the s coming after calm.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (the one not driving - suddenly) Hey fellow...!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Can you confirm your name?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Just making sure we didn't arrest the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You didn't. What's making you feel differently?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: You don't look like an outlaw.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm both. In and out.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Why did you guys do that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You mean, try to set animals free?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Are you only aware of what you've started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys don't seem to worry very much about that.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (to his partner, shrugging) Forget it. After a short break, the radio bursts out.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: (female) Patrol 76, what's with your suspect? Over.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (taking the radio) He's in the car with us. ETA, ten. Over.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: Very well. The lieutenant needs to talk to you... As she finishes, a heavy shock is heard. An infected just landed on the hood. Snarling at the two who gape at him. As the bloody guy moves to them with the obvious intentio 25 smash the windshield with one of his hands, OFFICER #1 br The creature is thrown off the hood. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Hello...? Because of the braking, the car behind them has to turn quickly to avoid the shock. It passes them... and becomes target for another infected. We can hear a window being shattered. Then some screaming They can do nothing but watch, helpless. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: God...  26 OFFICER #2 takes out his gun as he sees another infected rushing to them. He puts his window down and shoots. All very quickly. The infected collapses.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Drive! OFFICER #1 puts his foot down as his partner talks in the radio again. OFFICER #2 (cont'd) Lieutenant? LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Yeah. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We've got trouble! Wait a second... They have to take a quick turn as a couple of other rabid rush to them. OFFICER #2 (cont'd) Lieutenant... LIEUTENANT (v.o.) You're okay?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: No worries... so far. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) How's the suspect? Both cops turn to DAVID, who looks very agitated. They no

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: He's all right. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Tell him to confirm the address of that lab they broke in. (He gives an address.) Go ahead. OFFICER #2 turns to DAVID again, OFFICER #1 looks at him through the rear-view mirror. DAVID nods a yes.  27

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in the radio) He said yes. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Okay. Make sure he's alive and kicking and listening. We have some trouble here as well.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Have you been attacked in there? LIEUTENANT (v.o.) No, but the place is almost empty. Two police headquarters, both located in a short distance from that lab, have been overrun. So many guys here haven't waited for the same thing to happen here, they went to pick up their kids at school or straight home. We're receiving always less and less reports of the situation, and these reports always get more and more specific about that disease and the damage it just keeps causing.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: It's a disease? LIEUTENANT (v.o.) It's something in the blood. So yeah, it's a disease. Rage, I'd say. A secret virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant is speaking inside his office, seated behi his desk. As he speaks, several police cars patrol throughout the c of London, some of them being attacked one after another. alternate from one car, attacked or not, to another. And POLICE STATION to PATROL 76.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: I'm talking now to all cars, and I'm asking you to listen to this without interrupting, even if you get attacked. The situation hasn't improved, but it hasn't gone worse either. It can get better only if you keep shooting those freaky things on sight. From some of the (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: reports we received, once they get infected, they start running around and they do it very quickly, frantically, without stopping, until they hit anybody else. That's mainly why it's spreading that fast. The underground traffic also helps much. If possible, don't wait until they rush to you to pull the trigger, since their infected blood may hit you and reach your eyes or enter your mouth. The situation was considered so serious that the upper hand was just given to the army, over the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN and JEFF look at each other as the LIEUTENANT conti LIEUTENANT (v.o., cont'd) The army's already given everyone the instruction to stay home, lock their doors and windows and close their shutters. They've also posted soldiers in front of every public place in town, especially schools and hospitals, it doesn't mean you can't use your guns on those things any more. But it means that all our regular communications will be shut down. We also can expect radio and TV stations to stop broadcasting in any minute, until the situation is under control again. That’s why I asked you not to try to ask any question and to start any discussion. We don't have much time left. Just keep using our cars to go home and put your families together and safe. Many civilians will try to leave the city; please don't do the same. We need all of you here. Now this is for Patrol 76. The other cars are dismissed. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Lieutenant... LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Jeff...?  29

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes. Brian is driving. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) Check on our guy. Check his face.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: He's looking green now. He just shitted his pants. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) I guess you understood you can't bring him here. There'll be nobody to question him, not even to take him to the toilet. You'll have to let him go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't play with us now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not. I could have said that way before, but I'm polite. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) All this is your fault, mister. If I were you I wouldn't be so proud.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Go say that to those who made that stinky virus. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) I'm saying that to you. You were stupid enough to try to release animals that have been injected with all kinds of shit. You also know that most lab experiments are classified. It's your only fault.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, instead of letting him go, what about shooting him right away? He deserves to pay, he should pay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wasn't inside the lab, I didn't see what happened. If we knew for sure that (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 DAVID (cont'd) the chimps were infected with that shit, we'd have shot them all, instead of trying to set them free. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) No excuses, please. You're the ones who released that thing. Nobody else did.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not saying otherwise. Do you really believe we didn't suffer? My own friends attacked me. Now they're gone. I really lucked out. LIEUTENANT (v.o.) You guys take him home. Once there with his family he won't be able to go anywhere, it's too dangerous, I guess he knows it better than anybody else. Over and out. He cuts. JEFF puts down the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (after a few seconds of silence) Well, I would say you ain't cops any more. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You're right, asshole, but you know what? We ain't taxi drivers either.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: If you really believe we'll take you home, you're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And what about what your lieutenant said?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You just told us, we ain't cops any more. You're right about that. And our radio communications will be shut down at any time. He'll never know.  31

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Unless you go report to him at the station, but I don't believe you wanna do that. Both ‘cops’ reach the next corner, then BRIAN stops the c He takes out his gun. And has looks all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the vehicle, his gun in his hand, not poin Nothing suspect around him, so he opens one of the back d

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (getting out) You're leaving me here?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's not what you're supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (as he uncuffs DAVID) I know. But we have families too. We don't have time for you. Just take the underground or a cab. JEFF joins them, his gun in his hand as well, looking aro

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (handing something to DAVID) Take it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What does it look like? It's a walkie- talkie. It's on my private frequency. Keep it carefully and use it if you manage to get home. (as DAVID takes the device) Good luck, asshole.  32 Both cops get back in their car and drive away. EXT. STREETS — DAY DAVID stays there, not moving. And not totally believing. After escaping from infection and doing everything so his family doesn't have to face it, he is exposed again. With a fair chance to escape from it again though. But he doesn't know at once what to do or which way to go doesn't even know where exactly he is. He stays there, like he's waiting for a taxi. But there's one coming. From the lieutenant on his radio, he knows the undergroun no more an option. So he keeps waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's kids, ROBERT, EMILIA and VEE are in quite the sam situation, waiting for their mother to come and pick them They look rather anxious, since they can hear more and mo sirens, from more or less big distances. ROBERT's phone rings. He takes the call. WANDA (v.o.) Robert...?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Mum! WANDA (v.o.) Are you in front of the gate?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes, we're all waiting! What are you doing?  33

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'll be right there, baby! I'm so sorry, I'm blocked at an intersection... (she sees an infected one get into the traffic) ...look, I have to hang up, just stay where you are! I'll be right there! She cuts and watches for a moment. The infected one, a gi manages to smash a car window. The people in the car scre terror. The light goes green but there's no car moving. And no ho yelling. WANDA turns her wheel and gets on the sidewalk, driving a from the scene just as some other cars finally follow... as another infected one shows up, attacking another car s stopped. EXT. STREETS — DAY DAVID's still standing at the same spot. Still no taxi. He looks at the radio device Jeff gave him. Unusable, des the operational frequency. He takes his cell phone out of his pocket. Usable? Yes. H network's still operational. But his battery's almost dead. He looks around, trying to find a street name he can use. first valuable thing he sees is... ...an infected one, running frantically from a distance, looking around for a prey. Then running straight to someb and attacking with amazing ferocity. DAVID looks away, escapes from that sight of savagery surrounded by panic. He dials a number. INT. CAR — DAY WANDA can hear her phone ringing as she approaches the sc So she can't take the call.  34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT, EMILIA and VEE are still waiting outside, among a growing number of other kids, waiting as well. It's not s bus time yet. The gate is wide open, there's one soldier his uniform standing close by, holding a machine gun, and carrying a gun in a pocket. WANDA's car finally gets on the street, at high speed. Bu loses control and hits a parked car. And there it stays. The engine has stopped. WANDA is not injured but looks knocked down.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIA
dialogues.text: (simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: MUM
dialogues.text: The three kids run to the car, which is not seriously sma ROBERT manages to open the driver's seat and sees her mot half unconscious. He shakes her, as hard as he can.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Mum! Mum, come on! (keeping shaking her) Come on! Wake up! The two others start crying as ROBERT keeps shaking and shouting. Then... some heavy snarling. ROBERT hears it, despite the weeping. He freezes. He slams the door, opens the back one and rushes his brot sister and himself into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He locks both back doors, then he takes the passenger's s quickly, and locks both front doors.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (harshly) Get down, and keep quiet! He takes his still unconscious mum down with him, as the others obey.  35 ROBERT (cont'd) Now don't move an inch! EXT. SCHOOL —- DAY On the outside, two infected ones get closer, coming from different directions. One of them runs straight to the sm group of kids. The other one stops on the sidewalk, close the parked car.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (whispering) Both of you, hit the floor! And don't make a sound! As EMILIA and VEE reach the floor, WANDA moans a little. ROBERT puts a hand on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature is still standing on the sidewalk, snarling the empty, still seeming to wonder which car to tear apar It moves quickly, reaching the front of WANDA's car. It s there, waiting for some signal to attack, and sees nothin feels no movement inside right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other creature approaches the group at high speed, ro with dementious rage, ready to attack and bite deep. Holding his machine gun in his left hand, the SOLDIER use other hand to take out his gun. He aims and... fires. Onl once. The infected one drops dead, shot in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing hears the gunshot and turns his torn face to th group, with a mad snarl. And it runs to them, like crazy, screaming louder than ev The SOLDIER fires again.  36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT moves up. The thing is gone. He starts working on mum again.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Mum! Mum! Wake up! Mum, come on! After a short moment she finally emerges.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Oh... Rob... The three kids hug their mum from all sides. WANDA (cont'd) (holding her head) What happened...?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You've had a little accident... She seems to remember.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Oh... She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIA
dialogues.text: Mum, I wanna go home!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Sure, baby. She turns her key, but the engine just splutters. She tri two, three more times. No positive result. Then she looks up, and freezes. A shape is standing on the outside, right in front of the looking straight at her. Then it moves to the side. It stops by her door and knock the glass, two times. It's the SOLDIER. WANDA puts the glass down.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hello guys. Sorry if I scared you.  37

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I see. I have many kids with me, they need to go home but their parents haven't showed yet. Is it possible for you to take some of them? We'd really appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: We'd love to, but I think my car is dead.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Try again. She does, turning the ignition key again, two more times. Nothing. SOLDIER (cont'd) Keep your foot down on the accelerator. It will go. She presses the accelerator and turns the key again, and a little time, the engine starts at last.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Good. Please stop by the school gate.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Okay. As she drives to the gate, the soldier takes out his mach gun for better cover. EXT. STREETS — DAY A soldier in his uniform is unloading his machine gun. He  38 standing inside a big army jeep, along with some other soldiers. One of them is also firing. Many people get ruthlessly riddled with bullets before go down. We don't know if they are infected or not. The guys don't take any risk. Then another soldier, not holding a weapon, jumps off the vehicle. He takes out a gun as he walks to the bodies for checking. Some of the faces are torn, the others are not. He turns his body, head and gun to a shape, a man-like be standing not far from the scene, not moving. The soldier hesitates. From where he is, the guy's face l normal. It's DAVID. He puts his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm okay! I'm not infected! The soldier puts his gun away, looking around for safety.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I made the call about this.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How did it go? (a pause) I got kind of lucky, an army truck just picked me up. I'm on my way too. (a pause) Look, I really can't talk right now. And you can't either, right? You can't drive and listen to a complete exposé at the same time. Can't you be a little patient? That's all I ask. Just try to keep the kids and anyone else safe.  39 He cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WANDA puts her phone down. The car is full. Her three kid along with two teenage girls - are also in the car.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELDEST GIRL
dialogues.text: You're almost there!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I hope you have a key to get in.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELDEST GIRL
dialogues.text: My mother gave me a copy.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Where are your parents?

dialogues.speaker: THE ELDEST GIRL
dialogues.text: In hospital. Daddy's had an accident at work, today. They'll be back tonight. That's what Mommy said on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Okay, keep looking around, babies! We're approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops by a range of similar houses, in front of one o them. The neighbourhood is quiet. Both teenage girls are seated by one of the back windows, eldest one gets out first, her sister follows.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELDEST GIRL
dialogues.text: (to WANDA) So many thanks. We should pay you.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: You both get inside fast, babies, right now! And take care! As she rolls away, both girls rush to their house entranc door, and the eldest one searches her pockets. She finds her keys, they get inside fast and slam the doo behind them.  40 Just as they do, three infected freaks appear, running furiously along the street after Wanda's car. And as they pass the girls' house, a light is turned on f the inside, shining through the window's glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sunset when DAVID gets inside his own house. He does hear anything right away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello? No response. He's alone. Or maybe not. He starts an inspection process right away. Trying to mak as quick and specific as possible, turning no light on. He quickly checks the ground floor, then he goes upstairs opening every door without entering the rooms. Nothing and nobody. Relieved, or kind of, he gets inside every room, opens ev window and closes all the shutters. Then he goes back downstairs, walks to every window and, after carefully checking the outside, opens them and carefully and silent closes the shutters. Except one, in the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: from where he can see his family showing up. There is sti light on. He takes out the radio Jeff gave him, and pushes a button

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF takes out his radio in his turn.  41

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hello? (a pause) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Try to guess. We alternate from the house to the car.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh. The asshole.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Of course. So you've made it back home, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I have, but my wife and kids are still out there. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: My partner is home safe. I'm now working on my case.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How is it going?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not too good. There are more and more of those things out there. I got attacked twice since Brian dropped himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did you get any calls from any of your relatives?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not for some time.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: From where I am, I'm not receiving any news myself... oh...  42 A car just stopped in front of the house. WANDA's car.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I think they're here. I'm afraid I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay asshole. I'm happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Feel free to come back to me. He puts down the radio, without cutting off the line. Then he goes to the entrance door, opens it and walks out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked in the alley, WANDA and his three kids out quickly and run frantically to him, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Come on, go in, quick! QUICK !! DAVID is stunned by the loud, panicked voice from his wif has no time to wonder why. Several enraged shapes are running straight to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They manage to get inside and DAVID locks the door just b a big thud hits it, followed by more. The hallway is almost totally dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No light on! He has no time for hugging. He has something very importa do first. DAVID (cont'd) (almost whispering) Kids, go upstairs. Lock yourselves up in your rooms. And make no noise.  43 ROBERT, EMILIA and VEE start climbing the stairs, as the infected all snarl together outside, trying to break in. DAVID (cont'd) (to WANDA) Keep all the lights off for the moment. Don't turn any one on. I have a shutter to close, in the living room. If they see any light on, they'll break the window and get in. WANDA follows DAVID to the living entrance door. DAVID (cont'd) Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: He walks through the dark room to the window, to the radi which is sounding. DAVID (cont'd) Jeff! You're here?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everything's okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We have some problems.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I can hear that. Gimme your address. I'll follow it to the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT, EMILIA and VEE are locked in the same bedroom. Th light is on inside. The shutter is closed, so they can't what's happening outside. ROBERT is holding his trembling little brother and sister tight. Then he releases them and walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Turn off the light.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIA
dialogues.text: No, Rob!  44

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Turn it off! EMILIA turns off the light, and ROBERT opens the window, the shutter a very little bit. He looks down and for the first time, he can see what the infected look and act like. They still try to break in th the entrance door, banging it hard. Two of them stand at some distance, looking at something probably a window, waiting for a sign to break in the hou through it. Then one of them suddenly looks up, and ROBERT pulls out sight. So he can't see an army vehicle showing up. But he can he the first of a series of gunshots. He jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infected get shot one after another, first the ones standing not far from the window. The others turn crazy f to the shooters, they run to them and get shot in their t Two soldiers jump off the vehicle, holding guns. No machi gun was used. They fire some more, making sure. Then they walk back to the vehicle, they get back inside the vehicle leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all silent now. DAVID emerges from the floor, and risks a look outside. Through the window he sees several bloody bodies lying motionless in front of his house. He opens the window and closes the shutter. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV screen, a news break emerges. A woman is showed... on the street! She holds a microphon acting like everything is normal.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: We're about to enter the closest police station from Buckingham Palace, it's also the most protected and guarded one. The city is on high alert but let's see if we'll be able to collect some valuable info about the situation... She enters the building. Inside she sees people, some wit army uniforms, some others with police uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Nothing else? DAVID and WANDA are seated beside each other, in a couch facing the set. The screen shows the woman stopping a SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Sir? The man turns to her, then to the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: No photos, no interviews, please.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Could you tell us how the situation is evolving?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We're doing the best we can. That's all I can say.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Yes. Turn off that camera and go home. That's the best you can do to help us. That's it.  46 DAVID and WANDA smile at each other. The light is on in the room, there are also many lighted candles all across it and all across the house, in case t light goes off. DAVID changes the channel, and sees a blank screen. He continues changing channels. And finally comes back to still broadcasting one. This time the WOMAN stands close to a POLICE OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: ...the most important thing to understand is that people must stay home and lock themselves up, but many of them don't follow that very simple instruction or make mistakes, do stupid things, like throwing parties and making noise. From where we are we've been receiving reports of families attacked in their homes. As long as this kind of thing occurs, this plague - because we can call it a plague - will always gain ground. You want to know about the situation? It's not good, and it's not getting any better. I won't lie to make people feel better. Even if we get this situation under control again, there will be many casualties.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: What about the Royal Family?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You can check for yourself outside. Buckingham Palace is closed to the public and it will stay closed until this is definitely behind us. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you for talking to us, officer.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Now you should go home. Especially if you have a family. It's dangerous on (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 POLICE OFFICER (cont'd) the streets. In case you don't know, there is an army of psychopaths growing out there.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thanks again. (to the CAMERA) Let's go back outside, and try to get closer to Buckingham Palace where some Royal Family members took refuge a few hours ago... The screen goes blank. DAVID just changed the channel.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Give it up. What you have to tell me is more interesting. DAVID turns off the television.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There is nothing to say. I wasn't in the lab when the whole thing started. I was in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: And...? Tell me. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They were all infected when they came out. And they attacked us first. Me and Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was at the wheel, so Bruce went to open the back door. Mirka attacked him, he got infected, they both attacked me, I ran away.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It all happened very quickly, it's difficult to explain. One sure thing I can tell you, I was lucky.  48

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What about this... infection?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We didn't know. Nobody knows. It was a lab, they build plenty of viruses in that kind of place. Whatever we are facing, it was not supposed to get out.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I have to check the grill. She stands up and walks to the chimney. Some pork ribs ar roasting inside. She opens the chimney and works on the ribs with a fork. Then she closes the chimney, puts the fork down, stands b up and comes back to DAVID, sitting down close to him lik before. Robert, Emilia and Vee are sleeping on another couch. The still asleep when DAVID and WANDA start kissing softly. Until a voice breaks off. JEFF (v.o.) Hello? DAVID looks around. JEFF (v.o., cont'd) Hello? The three kids move in their sleep, without awakening.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (standing up) I have to take this.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Who is this? DAVID picks up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What's up coppy?  49 JEFF (v.o.) The coppy has a name, asshole, it's Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good to know. So what's up? Any good news? JEFF (v.o.) I guess the army showed up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They were fast, thanks again. JEFF (v.o.) How long?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: One, two minutes. JEFF (v.o.) That fast?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? JEFF (v.o.) Why? You got lucky again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so. You think I don't deserve to be? JEFF (v.o.) I think you deserve to be hanged.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why did you help me then? JEFF (v.o.) I don't know. Maybe because I kind of like you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Brilliant. I guess we can kiss good news goodbye, right? JEFF (v.o.) Right.  50

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Are you home? JEFF (v.o.) No.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut,

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I'm heading to the police station. My car is still there, I'll try to get it back. DAVID (v.o.) Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It's a great car. I don't want it wrecked or stolen. DAVID (v.o.) Is your car greater than your family?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I don't really have a family, asshole. I have a wife, but we're separated and she keeps the kid. She doesn't return my calls. DAVID (v.o.) You have a kid?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, a girl. I haven't seen her in eight months. DAVID (v.o.) I'm very sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don't be. I'll call you back. DAVID (v.o.) Good luck. JEFF puts down the radio.  51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The cop who arrested me today.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (frowning) Arrested...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Unofficially, yeah. They couldn't take me in. When this situation gets under control again, I guess they will come back for me again.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shrugging) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Was it him who gave you that radio?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Why did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.text: DAVID and WANDA are sort of asleep in the couch when the calls again. JEFF (v.o.) Hello? DAVID opens one eye and moves in his half sleep. JEFF (v.o., cont'd) Hello? DAVID picks up the radio, which is right beside him, lyin the couch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Jeff? WANDA moves and opens her eyes in her turn. JEFF (v.o.) Yeah, asshole, look, is it possible that I spend this night at your home?  55

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why, what happened? JEFF (v.o.) Let's say I don't wanna be on my own tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's it? JEFF (v.o.) No. I was attacked at the police station. But I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh... JEFF (v.o.) Don't worry, I won't put you under arrest. I just wanna keep feeling like a cop. You know, protect, serve, that kind of shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I see. Okay, I'll be waiting. JEFF (v.o.) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. Just don't park your car too close from our house, keep it some distance away. JEFF (v.o.) I'll do that. I will horn two times when I show up.

dialogues.text: All right. Just one condition... JEFF (v.o.) Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You stop calling me an asshole. JEFF (v.o.) (laughing) Of course. We got a deal.

dialogues.text: I have a name too, it's David. JEFF (v.o.) I know that.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good. Here's my address... JEFF (v.o.) I have it, you gave it to me before. I'll be right there. They cut the comm. DAVID stands up.

dialogues.text: Is he coming?

dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I mean, you're gonna host the cop who arrested you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (smiling and shrugging) He let me go after that.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: You mean he dropped you on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Same thing, basically. Forget about it. (looking at the kids, then at WANDA) Should I wake them up?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (after a pause) No.  57

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're right, it's better that way. He leaves the living, WANDA follows and they go to the entrance door. They keep the light off in the hallway. DAVID (cont'd) He said he would horn twice.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: He already knows where to find this house?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: When you came back with the kids, we had a big problem, I had to inform him. EXT. STREETS -— NIGHT JEFF's car rolls through the dark streets. It takes two turns, then it slows down and finally parks.

dialogues.text: JEFF manages to take all his stuff, and as he gets ready horns two times. He gets off the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Jeff? JEFF (v.o.) Yeah! all his guns and radio stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Many thanks. He looks relieved and dismayed in the same time. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (locking the door back) My God.

dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't look good.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We just heard some gunshots...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (looking at him) It was me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Honey, this is Jeff. Jeff, this is my wife, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (not taking it) Good evening, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: It's Wanda. 58 Carrying  59

dialogues.text: (chuckling a little) All right. You can call me Jeff. Sorry, I can't shake hands with you guys now. It's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I perfectly understand.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Later, promise. (a pause) Well... I'd need a clean-up.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: You'll be better off upstairs. Please follow me.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks again. He follows WANDA as she starts going up the stairs.

dialogues.text: The whole family is around the dining table, along with J They all look very tired. But they can't go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (about the numerous lighted candles on the table and all across the room and house) All this has nothing to do with religion.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (smiling) I know. The roasted pork ribs are also on the table, along with pans with the dinner inside. JEFF (cont'd) All this looks and smells really nice.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Thank you. JEFF's radio gear is also on the table. And it's on as we Some voices break off once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What can you get with this?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: As you know, David, the police radio comms have been shut off. Now the army is leading this, but they still collaborate with the police at a certain level, notably with some of our mounted division. Especially about the protection of the Royal family and the government. With this I can pick up their chats from their walkie-talkies. And keep myself posted about the situation.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why did you bring all that stuff in here?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Why not? It's better than a black TV screen. Don't you think so?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You don't know. I'm not sure if you're really aware of the seriousness of the situation. 60  61

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I am, don't worry about it. I have survived many attacks today. And I am probably the only one to have done so.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You lucked out, David. That's what you said. Since this started you've been very lucky. And because of that you may believe that everybody else will be as lucky as you have been, and still are. You were the first man exposed to the infection, and also the first one who survived an attack. So you began with sort of an advantage. You were prepared when nobody else was. Think about that. DAVID says nothing. JEFF (cont'd) (to him) I need to talk to you privately.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: All right. Both men stand up.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (to WANDA) It won't be long. Your kids don't need to hear this. JEFF and DAVID leave the living.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Do you know what happened to me just outside, as I was walking to your house?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, what?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I was attacked by cats.  62

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Cats?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yes. Infected cats.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How can animals get infected with this?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: How? This started with those infected lab monkeys you guys tried to set free, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm talking about normal animals, not lab guinea-pigs.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What's the difference? A virus can mutate and adapt to any environment. Lab or not.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It's pretty obvious, you don't need to be an expert to know that. There are many dead bodies all across London now, you know, lying on the streets. I guess cats and dogs, also foxes, come to those bodies and lick the blood off them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course. I hadn't thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I think that the infection spreads like this at night. Most of the way.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: As soon as I saw those cats rushing to me, their faces... I saw that this would be real hell.  63

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We have to deal with infected humans... as well as with infected animals.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: The army doesn't bother too much to take the bodies away. When it's the first and most important thing they have to do.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did you see the bodies in front of the house, as you were coming?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I did see some, yes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let's go back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Sorry for being a terrible guest.  64

dialogues.text: It could be worse.

dialogues.text: (to WANDA) I didn't even ask you what you do for a living.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'ma vet.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Veteran of what?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (chuckling with DAVID) Veterinarian.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.text: We both share love for each other, and for animals.

dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.text: (shrugs) That's too bad. But it doesn't really matter. DAVID, his wife and kids are still around the table with They have finished dinner.

dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?

dialogues.text: What they have to say doesn't matter. Unless something goes badly wrong. And in case something serious happens to them at Buckingham or Number 10 or any other key point of the city, they'll have to cut off the power around, so the infected can't see them.

dialogues.text: I'm afraid so.
