The last infected civilian (a woman) rushes to the scream woman and her camera man. He sees it, she doesn't, too bu yelling with terror and blowing her ears. A soldier shoots at the monster with his machine gun but panicked and misses many times, giving it the opportunity reach the two TV workers. The cameraman passes her and... hits the snarling thing w his camera! It's not powerful enough to knock it down but  70 gives it the time to get finally shot, once. It's thrown against the wall by the impact. It stands up again, looking daggers first at the still wo and filming camera man, then at the soldier who got close shoots it at point blank, in the head. In the meantime the last one is finished by its victim wh manages to shoot it from under. His fellow soldiers are around him and watch the infectio make its effect. The woman is still yelling, too terrifie be aware of anything, her camera man doesn't pay attentio comes over to the scene and tries to capture it but he's away by two of the boys.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (pushing him back) Go shut her up. The guy turns enraged, his eyes turn red, some blood star dripping off his mouth and nose. Then he looks around, at his 'mates', his face twisted, h teeth clinched. He doesn't have the time to attack. One of his mates puts a gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Not in the head! The guy aims at the thing's chest and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comm is still on but there's no more noise. WANDA sits back down. Very slowly, her face very pale. The three kids are still asleep on the couch, far from everything.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to WANDA) Maybe you could take the kids to bed. She nods, stands back up and walks away.  71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers keep standing around their two dead mates, f long moment. One of them moves to the TV workers. The CAMERA MAN is ho the sobbing WOMAN tight.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You've had enough? You almost got yourselves killed.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MAN
dialogues.text: I know. It's part of the job risks.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You still want to stay around?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MAN
dialogues.text: We need to cover this. Don't worry about us.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the sobbing WOMAN) Are you serious? The CAMERA MAN doesn't say anything more, the SOLDIER loo them with despair and walks away. He joins his group. The SERGEANT gets to the table and pi up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (in his radio) Delta 4, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Copy, over.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What's your position?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in his radio) We're approaching the location. ETA, two.  72 SERGEANT (v.o.) Good, keep us posted.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What's the situation on your side? SERGEANT (v.o.) It's not too good. We just lost three men. You guys be very careful, don't make it worse. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ARMY QUARTER
dialogues.text: The helicopter approaches the building, and soon hits the ground. Five armed soldiers come out, with their weapons pointed, two of them stay close to the chopper, the other walk to the building and can immediately see the damage. Dead bodies everywhere, on the pavement and sidewalk. Sol and civilians, with all their faces twisted, and their ey blood red.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: They've been shot! All of them! The other guys don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ARMY QUARTER
dialogues.text: They enter the building. The light is on inside. There is sound. More dead bodies on the floor. This time, only civilians. All infected and shot as well. And much blood the floor and walls. They check the rest of the place, with the same result. O dead bodies, all civilians and infected.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ARMY QUARTER
dialogues.text: They meet again just outside. Again they check the bodies riddled with bullets. Then they nod to each other and, wi saying anything, they look up.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: There! They follow the direction and all point their weapons at light source from a flat above. The light source is point straight at them.  73

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM ABOVE
dialogues.text: We're from the police!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The police??

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM ABOVE
dialogues.text: Yes! We're coming down, all right?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: All right! Hurry! And be careful! The light source vanishes, they put their guns down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant is getting a radio report. VOICE (v.o.) A massacre. No one survived. All of them were infected. I can't explain what happened.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Easy to explain. The infected came too many. They couldn't kill all of them. VOICE (v.o.) Probably. And fortunately a couple of married cops was living close by, they did the job.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Cops? VOICE (v.o.) Yeah. They showed us their badges.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Good. All right, thank you. (cutting and putting down the radio) Okay. We have no choice now, gents, we'll have to cut off the power.  74 They all nod sadly.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We'll have to let the population know about that.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Of course. (pointing a finger at the TV workers) Bring them here. Now we're gonna need those two shitheads for once.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: They'll cut off the electricity. I'm pretty sure about that. They don't have a choice. He takes his flashlight out of his coat, and checks it.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'll check what's on TV. She stands up, and goes to pick the TV remote control. As uses it to turn the TV on she quickly notices something burning in the chimney. The WOMAN appears on the screen. She's still inside the p station. WANDA (cont'd) Come on guys, look at this! DAVID and JEFF stand up in their turns and come over.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (frowning) They're still broadcasting?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (looks surprised) Apparently yes...

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (frowning) She looks different than before.  75

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: ...after suffering a couple of bloody attacks, the army has decided to cut off the power throughout the city of London, but only during night time, in order to fight the threat more effectively. To the people who are watching this, and who don't have a generator, please get as many candles and flashlights as you can. The electricity will go off in five minutes from now. Take great care of yourselves, I wish all of you a normal, peaceful night anyway. We will be back on track first time next morning, at sunrise. The CAMERA turns to a SOLDIER standing by.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: And of course stay home, all your doors and windows carefully locked. If you have parties planned, postpone them and wait until the problem is solved. (his eyes drift to the woman) Come over, follow me. The CAMERA follows the SOLDIER and soon captures his dead mates on the floor. It ZOOMS in on the twisted, bloody fa Faces of nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (horrified) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Is that what you saw?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: We all did.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Turn it off. I've seen enough.  76 As WANDA turns off the TV, DAVID goes back to his seat an holds his head in his hands. DAVID (cont'd) (after a moment) If even groups of soldiers can get infected, with all the weapons they have...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, but in the dark they will have the advantage. Let's hope they will eliminate the threat during this night.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: We should all go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (with a big sigh) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: That's the only thing we can do now. I'll turn these off.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'll take care of the fire. As JEFF turns off his radio gear, WANDA goes to the chimn squats by it, opens its door. The thing burning inside is still there. It's not a pile wood. It's something else. Something roasting. WANDA frow with disgust from the smell. As she gives it a poke... the thing moves, very slightly. part of it turns to her. WANDA opens her eyes wide as she understands, but it's to late. With a muffled growl, the roasting thing leaps off the ch and reaches her hand. And bites. WANDA screams with the burning pain, as well as with horr DAVID and JEFF turn to her, to the ball of fire sticking her hand.  77

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (still yelling) HELP ME !! Take that thing off me !! JEFF takes out his gun and points it. Both men go to her, knowing too much what to do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Wanda, stop moving!! He gets closer, aims carefully and fires. The thing is thrown off WANDA's hand to the floor, where starts moving and rolling around furiously and franticall Soon it reaches the back of the den and the long curtains setting fire to them. As JEFF keeps his eyes on the still roasting and rolling thing, DAVID looks down at his trembling, gasping wife. H squats by her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Baby... you're okay? WANDA's burned hand is bleeding very bad, the blood comin it almost black. But soon the blood starts coming off fro another part of her shaking body. Horrified, DAVID sees his wife turning into the same kind rabid thing he saw before, at the lab. He stands up quick with a hiccup. In the meantime, JEFF shoots the frenzy ball of fire agai killing it for good, as the curtains combust progressivel rather quickly. He manages to get them down on the floor starts working on the fire with his feet. And finally con it, surrounded by black, heavy smoke. He still can see what's going on. WANDA now infected, sti the floor, her husband walking slowly backwards, away fro her, his face in total pain. He coughs and WANDA suddenly turns to him with a furious snarl. Her face has totally changed. Her eyes have turned blood red.  78 She's finished. JEFF puts his gun on her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (crying out) NO !! Don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, David! Keep away! JEFF keeps his gun on her/it, as DAVID keeps walking back away, Slowly. His face is in tears. The rabid thing keeps eyes on JEFF and his pointed gun. Suddenly, at full speed, it bolts up and charges at JEFF. fires, as quickly. It gets hit in the shoulder and is thrown backwards, fall heavily on its back. That's not enough to calm it down. JEFF fires again, one more time, shooting it in the leg, can't rush him again. It roars with pain. The noise is aw

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (his eyes still on it) David... He gets no response. JEFF (cont'd) David? He looks at him. DAVID is like paralyzed. Unable to move say a word. JEFF (cont'd) (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: DAVID moves a bit. And looks at JEFF. JEFF (cont'd) My blackjack is in my coat, on the chair. Go take it and give it to me. DAVID moves to the other side of the table. He reaches JE coat and finally takes the blackjack out of one of his in pockets.  79 JEFF (cont'd) Throw it to me. Come on! DAVID throws the object to JEFF, who catches it with his hand. Then JEFF starts walking to the mad thing on the fl with much precaution, his pointed gun in one hand, his blackjack in the other. It can't rush him no more, but it still can spit blood towards his face. And he doesn't hav mask. The door opens and ROBERT appears in the doorway, in pyja not coming in. He sees his father first.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Dad...? What's happening here? What's that smell...? The smell gets quickly too strong and he puts a hand up t mouth and nose, with a moan. They all turn to him, with totally different expressions, he looks around the heavily smoky room. While JEFF and DA show total surprise, the thing on the floor snarls furiou and, despite its shot leg, it charges at the kid, crawlin frantically to his legs. JEFF knocks it on the head with his blackjack before it c reach the boy. He does it again, so it doesn't move any m ROBERT, his hand still blowing his nose, gapes at what us be his mother. It doesn't last long, DAVID grabs him and leaves the room. JEFF closes the door before too much smoke runs out. He p the blackjack on the table, then he looks around, takes o pair of cuffs and, his gun still on the unconscious creat head, he closes them around one of its wrists and drags t bleeding body until he ties the hand to a pipe running cl to the floor, far away enough from the door. This done, he quickly moves away from the body, takes out hankie and puts it up to his nose, catching his breath th the still heavy smoke. He finds his way back to one of the windows. The one with more curtains in front. With his two hands, he opens it, then he opens the shutte immediately points his gun around.  80 It's all quiet outside. Not a movement, not a sound but s light wind. The street lights are still on. Not for long. The burned, smoking curtains are still lying on the floor JEFF has to turn his face away from the outside for two seconds as he picks them up, then he throws them out. The curtains end up... on some human shape, moving very c His face covered. JEFF gasps with horror as the shape struggles to get rid of the big piece of tissue. As it finally does, it roars horribly at JEFF, showing an awfully rabid face, and big, blood red eyes lit up by the candles reflected in them. JEFF manages to shoot it fast and it drops without a soun

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (panting) What the f...! Shit! Still panting hard, he looks down at the ground outside a sees only the smoky curtains, partly covering the dead bo just as a shroud would. As he does it, a CARD appears, fading in:

dialogues.speaker: HOURS AFTER VIRUS OUTBREAK
dialogues.text: The CARD is still on as... the street lights go off. Tota darkness outside. JEFF (cont'd) Dammit... He closes the shutter, fast, and the CARD fades out. Only couple of seconds later, a thud hits it hard. He closes the window, as DAVID shows up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What happened? Another thud, this time muffled.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I had to open a window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why?  81

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What do you think? Close the door! (as DAVID closes the door) I had to, there was no more air. And I had to get rid of the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why did you fire your gun?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don't you hear that? DAVID can hear the muffled banging on the shutters, with snarling going with it. JEFF (cont'd) Watch your wife.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Stay away from her. DAVID looks down at her/it, still lying unconscious by th pipe, as JEFF walks back to the table. He picks up his flashlight, turns it on and puts it down the burned little animal on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you think it is?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No idea. It could be anything, dog, fox, skunk... one sure thing, it was very young. And it stinks. He comes closer to DAVID and together they look down at w used to be called Wanda. JEFF puts his gun on it. JEFF (cont'd) Your decision. Try to make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I can't make such a decision now.  82

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. She can wait. The first thing you need to do is make sure your son doesn't tell his brother and sister about what he saw here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Can you handle that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'll have to. JEFF examines the door. There is a lock on it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Do you have a key for this door?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay, this door needs to be locked for the night. So your kids don't have a chance to see their mother like this. (DAVID nods.) And it would be better if you and your kids stay in the same room tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: All right. Let's extinguish the candles and go upstairs. Come on. Without keeping watching the thing on the floor, JEFF pic his blackjack from the table, then DAVID blows off one of candles and... THE SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. BEDROOM —- NIGHT DAVID holds a candle as he silently enters the bedroom occupied by his two sons.  He checks the two beds, ROBERT moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, Rob. You should be sleeping. They almost whisper, all the way.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We've had some problems downstairs, but everything is okay now.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I mean, what happened to Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Nothing happened to you mother.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I heard her screaming!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It was nothing. She's busy downstairs, she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Why is she not here, with you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I just told you, she's busy downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I wanna see her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You wanna go back to sleep. You will see her later. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LANDING
dialogues.text: DAVID comes out of the bedroom, closes the door... and dissolves into tears, going down, his back against the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF, holding a lighted candle in one hand, uses the othe shake DAVID who's asleep on the floor, inside EMILIA's bedroom, by her bed.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (whispering) David...! David...! DAVID finally wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Keep it down. It's 6.30.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What...? Er...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It's sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh... oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Time of my round. I'll need your help. (as DAVID groans) Sh-sh. Don't wake her up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Gimme your hand. DAVID gives him his hand and JEFF helps him up. JEFF (cont'd) Let's go. They leave the bedroom and close the door, silently.  85

dialogues.speaker: LANDING
dialogues.text: JEFF (cont'd) (handing him the cup with the candle on it) Take this. DAVID takes the cup, JEFF takes out his flashlight, turns on. Then he takes out his gun. JEFF (cont'd) Follow me. He starts going down, his gun and flashlight pointed, DAV follows. JEFF checks the place as they go down. Nothing to report. reach the

dialogues.speaker: GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: and stops by the door leading to the living. JEFF keeps t light on the lock.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Have you made a decision?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You have to come with something about this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not now. Later. Imagine some breaking news: an antidote, for instance!  86

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Unlock the door. We need to check the news anyway. DAVID nods, takes out a key off one of his pockets. He un the door, as JEFF cocks his pointed gun. And as some snar gets heard. JEFF gets against the wall. JEFF (cont'd) Stay behind me. DAVID gets against the wall behind JEFF who pushes the do open, without going into the living. Some heavy snarl, but no infected coming out. JEFF (cont'd) (nodding) All right. We're going in. You stay behind me, and you don't show her your face. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. JEFF nods, then he takes out his riot mask and puts it on then, his gun and flashlight still pointed, he enters the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM,
dialogues.text: the thing in front of him, DAVID carefully following, a h up on his nose. The thing is half squatted, half lying, its arm still tie the pipe. Made more furious than ever by heavy blood hung and the light, sent straight to its face. JEFF and DAVID progress inside the room, away from it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Go on, switch on the TV!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I would, if I knew where the control is. JEFF moves his flashlight around, catches the device, DAV goes for it.  87

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Easy. DAVID picks up the device, pushes a button and... switche the TV set. JEFF (cont'd) (removing his mask) The power is back on! The channel is broadcasting, live from the Buckingham Pal area. With a big difference, it's now showing images from cameras around and inside the police station. Alternating one camera to another.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: This doesn't look so good.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It's still better than a black screen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The TV guys must have been attacked.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Maybe they got home.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Look at the doors.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I see, they're all closed. It doesn't mean a thing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hope you're right. He changes channels... and finds nothing else. DAVID (cont'd) Great! He gets back to the only channel still broadcasting, befo turning to the spot where what used to be his wife is stu It's still snarling hard. Struggling as hard to turn loos He can hear it suddenly vomiting. DAVID (cont'd) Oh, God...  88

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hey David... look at this. DAVID turns back to the screen. They see a soldier enteri the frame, followed by two people. They recognize the female TV journalist, followed by her camera man. The soldier knocks three times on the police station's entrance door, which is opened from the outside. And the TV workers walk out. The soldier closes the door. Only a few seconds later... the light is turned on! Both men are totally caught off guard by this. So is... a little boy, by something else. He starts screaming very l with terror. JEFF and DAVID turn around and see ROBERT in doorway. The kid just saw his mother. Or what's left of h

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (yelling as well) ROB !! What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MOMMY
dialogues.text: His mommy roars furiously as a response, fighting even ha turn loose. Her wrist is bleeding hard under and around t tight braces.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Get away from her!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (putting his mask back on) Take him away! He grabs DAVID, forcing him to his son as he stands betwe DAVID takes ROBERT out of the room, JEFF closes the door. He still can hear ROBERT crying loud and David saying: DAVID (o0.s.) Stop! You'll wake up the others! Then JEFF looks at the thing and has a gasp. What he sees horrible. What used to be Wanda is lying in a large and t pool of her own infected blood. Blood from her two bullet wounds and from her vomiting.  89 The creature had changed horribly, it's nothing more than human shape painted in red blood, with spoiled clothes an torn face, in a grotesque position. AS JEFF takes out his gun and puts it on it, a CARD fades

dialogues.speaker: HOURS AFTER VIRUS OUTBREAK
dialogues.text: The thing almost calms down, asking for him to shoot. But he doesn't. Instead he walks away, to the TV screen, putting his gun removing his mask. The CARD fades away. The WOMAN had started talking. She's standing OUTSIDE the station, with soldiers surrounding her.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: the sun is rising over London now, and the electricity was just put back on all over the city by the army which unfortunately had to suffer some other attacks and casualties during the night. The situation has not improved so the instructions remain the same for everyone, stay locked up in your homes, don't open your doors and windows to anyone, and watch your youngest kids very carefully in case of banging on your doors, so they don't open them. Some other army units are expected to come from other cities, not only in England, but also from other countries such as Belgium, France or Holland. London was declared yesterday in a state of siege, please don't misinterpret our presence on the streets, they're totally dead except around some of the key spots like this one... The CAMERA turns to the Buckingham Palace area where a la quantity of gunmen, mounted or not, is gathered.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No good at all.  90 He turns away from the screen but can't find the remote, can't switch off the TV. As the WOMAN keeps talking, he puts his mask on the groun then he looks for the wire and plug, he finds them and un the set. Then he picks up his mask, puts it back on, manages to pi the set and carries it out of the room, to the

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: He manages to find the switch and to turn the light on, t he puts the TV set on the table. DAVID finally comes back, and almost sees a stranger with mask on. Until he hears his voice.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Stay here. He has to go back to the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: and gets his radio gear back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (as he leaves the room) Close this door and lock it for good. DAVID does it, as JEFF re-enters the kitchen with his gea INT. KITCHEN — MORNING The light is on, the shutter still closed according to instructions. JEFF and DAVID are alone around the table.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I guess we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: How did it happen with the kid?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to see her, well... you did. I'm sorry you had to see her like this.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You said she was okay!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course I said she was okay, what else was I supposed to say? It was for your protection. It was very careless and stupid of you to follow us down here.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: I don't understand. How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: An animal... it came down through the chimney. The smell from the grills probably attracted it. It bit her in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You mean...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She's infected. She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry... ROBERT starts sobbing, violently. DAVID tries to hug him, kid turns loose, as he keeps sobbing. DAVID (cont'd) Rob... listen to me. Stop crying. The boy can't stop. DAVID (cont'd) Rob... please.  92 The boy starts going upstairs, DAVID tries to stop him bu ROBERT turns loose again, keeping going and crying.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: DAVID (cont'd) I'll be in your room in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Will he be all right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I don't know. (pointing at the TV set) Have you heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yes, that journalist gave her report. It's bad, really bad. The soldiers are on the edge. More of them are expected from other cities and countries, but... You know, the more this is getting serious, the more I'm wondering if the infected have the ability to see clearly in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You mean, all their senses, like... tenfold?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not all, but... some better vision. Something like that. What do you plan to do? About all this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shrugging with despair) What would you do, except try to protect your kids from this? I guess it all depends on you.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not on me. I won't do a thing. And even if I wanted to... I couldn't. I can't even contact my wife and kid. There's no way for me to know if they're okay. You know why. I get hosted by you and your family for only one night and I see this.  93

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you think we should do?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Except wait until something good comes up... I don't see anything. We can't get out of the house, we can't even open a shutter, it's too dangerous. But I must try to contact the army and tell them to burn any dead body in sight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I think they know it already.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: But I don't believe they do it properly. I can bet that there still are bodies lying in front, and still intact. What about you, any idea?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your mates are probably looking for me again.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It's a possibility.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's more than a possibility. But they don't know where I live. This house is under my wife's name. I mean, her maiden name. Not mine. And the army doesn't have any file on me.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So they won't find you...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: -..unless you call them about me.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I just told you...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know. Even if you wanted to... you wouldn't be able to.  94

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I wouldn't help them anyway. I saw you losing your wife and almost losing your eldest kid, all this within only a few hours. I won't add to it. They will find you, but without my support.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And I guess, not before some time.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (nods) You should go take care of your kids. I'll set everything here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: All right. He stands up and leaves the kitchen. As he's about to pas doorway, he turns to JEFF. DAVID (cont'd) Thank you.
